Fetal movements and fetal heart auscultation in low risk antenatal care 
• As lo
ng as there are good fetal movements and good SF growth with each subsequent visit, in a low-risk person,
there is no additional value of listening to the fetal heart rate.
• Auscultation will confirm that the fetus is alive but is unlikely to have any predictive value.
• Routine auscultation is therefore not recommended.
• If requested by the mother, auscultation of the fetal heart may provide reas
